_prev_prog_3.Description: The Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM) unit consists of three production reactors and two purification trains. The VAM is stored as a liquid in multiple storage tanks that were built to API code and are within containment. A fire water system with hydrant monitors is available for mitigation. The tanks have a remote level sensor, which alarms at high and high-high levels in the control room as well as a direct reading gauge at the tank. The tanks also have manual and remotely actuated valves to control flow into and out of them.  Propane is used as a refridgerant in the VAM unit.  The liquid volume is contained in five individual process vessles.  The production reactors and purification trains are protected by a variety of sensors and pressure relief devices. The VAM unit is controlled by a DCS and has numerous alarms, warnings and process readouts which allow the unit operators to monitor and control the process. LyondellBasell Acetyls participates in a complex Emergency Response Team. The team has trained fire and hazardous materials responders who have been trained to the appropriate standards. Unit operators are trained on emergency procedures, including the overfilling scenario.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

LyondellBasell Acetyls is committed to employee and public safety and to protecting the environment. This commitment is inherent to our an the accidental release prevention program which covers areas such process hazard analysis, management of change, pre-startup safety reviews, operating procedures, mechanical integrity, and training.  Safeguards are in place to prevent releases of regulated substances.  If a release of a regulated substance were to occur, our trained emergency response personnel will be engaged to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  LyondellBasell Acetyls also coordinates with Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) which provides additional emergency response expertise.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled 

LyondellBasell Acetyls' primary activities encompass Vinyl Acetate Monomer and Acetic Acid. There are two regulated substances present at LyondellBasell Acetyls in quantities greater than or equal to their threshold quantities (as listed below): 

Propane            

Vinyl Acetate Monomer     



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 

LyondellBasell Acetyls has taken the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR Part 68.  The facility is also subject to the OSHA Process Safety Management standard under 29 CFR 1910.119.

Process Safety Information

LyondellBasell Acetyls maintains process safety information that includes information pertaining to the hazards of the regulated substances used or produced by the process, information pertaining to the technology of the process, and information pertaining to the equipment in the process.



Process Hazard Analysis

LyondellBasell Acetyls conducts Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) to ensure that hazards associated with the process are identified and mitigated.  The studies are undertaken by

a team of personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at least every five years.  Findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures

LyondellBasell Acetyls maintains written operating procedures for the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround.  Operating procedures are regularly reviewed and are readily accessible to operators involved with the processes.



Training

LyondellBasell Acetyls has a training program in place to ensure employees that are operating processes are knowledgeable in the operating procedures associated with these processes. New employees receive basic training in process operations followed by on-the-job supervision until they are deemed competent to work independently. Refresher training is provided at least every three years or more frequently as needed.



Mechanical Integrity

LyondellBasell Acetyls carries out documented maintenance checks and inspections on process equipment to ensure its integrity. Examples of process equipment examined by these checks includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  Maintenance operations are carried out by trained and qualified personnel Equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks or inspections are corrected in a safe and timely manner.



Management of Change

The Management of Change process in place at LyondellBasell Acetyls controls changes to process chemicals, equipment, technology, personnel, and procedures.  Reviews are conducted prior to implementation to ensure that the change does not have adverse impact on safety, health or the environment.  The Management of Change proce

ss includes notification or training of affected personnel.



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews

Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes are conducted as a regular practice at LyondellBasell Acetyls. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.



Compliance Audits

LyondellBasell Acetyls conducts compliance audits at least every three years to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented.  Corrective actions required as a result of the audits are addressed in a prompt manner.

Incident Investigation 

LyondellBasell Acetyls investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could have reasonably resulted in, significant release of a regulated substance. These investigations identify the immediate and underlying cause(s) as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. 

Employee Participation

Company employees and contractors are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to information created as part of the facility's implementation to the RMP rule including process safety information and process hazard analyses results.  Employees participate on investigation teams, safety teams, and audit teams.



Contractors

Our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out. LyondellBasell Acetyls informs the contractors of known potential hazards related to contractors work and the processes.  Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur.  Contractor post evaluations are also conducted to ens

ure compliance with LyondellBasell Acetyls safety and health procedures.   





4. Five Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases in the past five years that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage.



5. Emergency Response Plan

LyondellBasell Acetyls has developed a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes emergency response activities such as providing adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.  To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.  In addition, the emergency response plan is promptly updated to reflect changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response.  The La Porte Police Department is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated.



6. Emergency Response Team

LyondellBasell Acetyls has gone above and beyond the normal safety requirements to provide employees with a safe working environment.  One program that enhances our ability to respond to emergencies is our Emergency Response Program. Members of the Emergency Response Team (ERT) undergo training that includes classroom and on-the-job training as well as regular emergency drills.  A highly trained and confident ERT can limit damage during an emergency event, but more importantly prompt emergency response can prevent more serious accidents from occurring.  Our teams regularly attend some of the best training programs available, in particular, the programs conducted at Texas A&M University.



Planned changes to improve safety

The plant has planned improvements to alarm systems, safety interlocks systems, and level cont
rol systems to improve safety at the site.
